intro: Bubbia howeana, commonly known as the Howe's burrgrass, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Bubbia howeana is often found in sandy soils and can thrive in areas with low rainfall.
